page.title: 17CONSERVATION IN MAPPERLEY
page.content: On Sherwood Vale some people from the British Trust for Conservation Volunteers are working on an old railway embankment and are cutting down sycamores and planting native species.Before,people used it for a dump-children made dens in it and used it as a scrambling course for motorbikes and there was graffiti on the bridge walls.In 1983 the conservation volunteers started work on it,and hope to finish in 1985.They are making a nature area to attract butterflies,birds and other wildlife. The Scouts help on Saturdays and Sundays.They are making a wetland area for water wildlife.They are making a path for people to enjoy it.The residents are now happy about the scheme as it improves the area. Mark Ellis,Paul Duflot.
